page.title: 17BEAUTY SPOTS NEAR FARLEIGH
page.content: { IFORD}(79 58) IS A TINY PLACE ABOUT 1 KM. NORTH OF FARLEIGH HUNGERFORD, WHICH CONSISTS OF TWO FARMS AND A HANDFUL OF HOUSES. THE CATTLE ON BOTH FARMS ARE FRIESIANS. MOST OF THE LAND IS USED FOR GRAZING, ALTHOUGH A FEW FIELDS ARE SOWN WITH HAY AND BARLEY. BOTH FARMHOUSES ARE PICTURESQUELY SITUATED, AND ARE USED FOR BED AND BREAKFAST. JUST BEYOND THE FARMS, THERE IS A MANOR HOUSE, WITH BEAUTIFUL GROUNDS, WHICH ARE WELL WORTH A VISIT IN SUMMER. THERE IS ALSO A LARGE WOOD, WITH LOTS OF PHEASANTS, AND OTHER BIRDS AND ANIMALS. THE HEDGEROWS PROVIDE COVER FOR MANY TIMID MAMMALS. A TRIBUTARY OF THE RIVER FROME, WHICH IS OWNED BY BATHAMPTON A.A., FLOWS THROUGH THIS AREA. COOT AND MOORHEN FREQUENT THE RUSHES BY THE WEIR, WHILE CHUB, DACE AND PERCH CAN ALSO BE SEEN.
